pages.text: The steam exosuit differs from normal armour in that it has an internal steam tank and no durability. When worn it provides passive benefits but drains steam at a constant rate. When the armour runs out of steam it stops providing benefits.

The exosuit boots can redirect the energy from a fall into a higher jump. While they have steam you take less fall damage. Additionally if you jump at the moment of impact you'll go much higher then normal.
The exosuit legs amplify your own muscle movements. While they have steam you move slightly faster.
The exosuit chest provides additional striking power to your arms. While it has steam you deal one more heart of damage per hit in melee combat.
The exosuit helm doesn't have any passive benefits but can take 2 upgrades instead of the usual 1.
These items are upgradable, possible upgrades are listed on the following pages.
Adding a steam canister doubles the armor's steam tank capacity.
Adding a diamond chestplate provides 2 points of extra armor to the exo suit peice.

Only boots can accept this upgrade. Adding a steam piston boosts your base jump height to 3 blocks. This height increase stacks with the boots passive. Each jump with this upgrade consumes 2 seconds worth of steam from the boots tank.
Only the helm can accept this upgrade. Adding an ender eye grants night vision while the helm has steam.
Only the helm can accept this upgrade. Adding a spectral arrow grants the ability to see creatures through walls while the helm has steam.
Only the chest can accept this upgrade. Adding a piston gives your hits one hell of a follow through. Doing so requires a significant amount of steam per hit.
